name: Aminophylline
reference:
The dose must be individualized according to serum theophylline level (10-20 mcg/mL).
Adult: loading dose: 5.7 mg/kg over 30 min, maintenance: 0.5 mg/kg/hr, MAX dose 1125 mg/day

name: Amiodarone
reference: 24-hours loading: 150mg first 10-minutes, then 1mg/minutes over next 6 hours, then 0.5mg/min over next 18 hours

name: Atracurium
reference: Continuous infusion: 5-10µg/kg/minute

name: Cisatracurium
reference: Continuous infusion: 1-3µg/kg/minute

name: Clonidine
reference: 0.5-2mcg/kg/hr

name: Dexmedetomidine
reference: 0.2- 1.5 mcg/kg/hour

name: Diltiazem
reference: Atrial fibrillation or atrial flutter: continued reduction of the heart rate (up to 24 hours), IV bolus of 20 mg (0.25 mg/kg), infusion rate: 5 mg/h to 15 mg/h as needed; Diltiazem/Cardizem

name: Dobutamine
reference: Dose: 2-20 µg/kg/minute

name: Dopamine
reference: Dose: 2-20 µg/kg/minute

name: Epinephrine Bradycardia
reference: IV infusion for bradycardia: run at 2-10 µg/min (titrated to effect); Epinephrine(Bradycardia)

name: Epinephrine Hypotension
reference: Post-cardiac arrest hypotension: The dosing is 0.1-0.5 µg/kg/min; Epinephrine(Hypotension)

name: Esmolol
reference: Loading Dose: 500 ug/kg IV direct over one minute Maintenance Dose: 20 -200 ug/kg/min IV infusion

name: Fentanyl
reference: 1-2 mcg/kg/hr

name: Furosemide
reference: Usual dose range: 10-20 mg/hr (1-2 mL/hr). Maximum rate: 20 mg/hr (2 mL/hr). Maximum TOTAL dose in 24 hours: 480 mg (48 mL).

name: Heparin
reference: UA/NSTEMI: 12-14 unit/kg/hour

name: Insulin
reference: Adjust infusion rate according to your protocol. A simple example: glucose(mg/dl): dose(u/h) 110-140:1, 141-220:2, 221~300:3, 301~400:4, >400:6, finger stick q1h

name: Isoprenaline
reference: 1-4mcg/min

name: Ketamine
reference: for sedation and analgesia during procedures: 0.2 to 1.0 milligram/kilogram over 2 to 3 minutes, followed by continuous infusion of 0.3 - 1.2 mg/kg/hr as required

name: Labetalol
reference:
Hypertensive Emergency: 20 mg IV over 2 minutes, then 40-80 mg IV q10min
Continuous infusion: 1-2 mg/min

name: Levosimendan
reference: infusion at 0.1 micrograms /kg /min and continue for 24 hours

name: Lidocaine
reference:
Maintenance infusion: 1 to 4 mg/min
Cardiac Arrest from VT/VF: Initial dose: 1 to 1.5 mg/kg IV/IO
For refractory VF, stable VT, wide-complex tachycardia of uncertain type and significant ectopy may give additional 0.5 to 0.75 mg/kg IV push, repeat in 5 to 10 minutes, maximum 3 doses or total of 3mg/kg; Lidocaine

name: Magnesium ACLS
reference:
Cardiac arrest due to hypomagnesemia or torsades de pointes: 1 to 2 grams IV or IO (diluted in 10 ml of D5W or normal saline)
Torsades with a pulse: a loading dose of 1 to 2 grams mixed in 50 to 100 ml of D5W or normal saline should be given IV over 5 to 60 minutes. This may be followed with a dose of 0.5 to 1 gram per hour IV, titrated to control torsades de pointes.

name: Metaraminol
reference: infusion rate of 0-16ml/hr.

name: Midazolam
reference:
Sedation: 20-100 µg/kg/hour
Refractory Status Epilepticus: 50-200µg/kg/hour

name: Milrinone
reference: 50 mcg/kg loading dose by IV push over 10 minutes, then 0.375-0.75 mcg/kg/min IV

name: Morphine
reference: Initial 10 to 20micrograms/kg/hour

name: NTG
reference: 5 µg/min, increase by 5 µg/min q3-5min up to 20 µg/min, then increase by 10 or 20 µg/min if need

name: Naloxone
reference: Maintenance Infusions: loading dose: 0.4mg 0.1 - 0.4mg/h

name: Nicardipine
reference: IV: 5 mg/hr initially, may be increased by 2.5 mg/hr every 15 minutes, not to exceed 15 mg/hr

name: Nimodipine
reference: 15 µg/kg/h via a central catheter for 2 hours, then 30 µg/kg/h

name: Nitroprusside
reference:
hypertensive crisis: Initial rate: 0.3 mcg/kg/min; evaluate BP for at least 5 minutes
Not to exceed 10 mcg/kg/min

name: Norepinephrine
reference:
Adults: 2-20 µg/min
Start at 8 µg/min, and titrate to desired MAP(>65)

name: Octreotide
reference: Gastrointestinal bleeding 50 - 100 ug IV bolus 25 - 50 ug/hour IV infusion for 1 to 5 days

name: Pantoprazole
reference: 8mg/hr

name: Phenylephrine
reference: Bolus dose: hypotension or shock: 0.1-0.5mg (100-500 mcg) as slow IV direct injection q10-15min PSVT: 0.5-1mg as rapid direct IV injection q60-90 seconds IV infusion: 0.04-0.18mg/min (40-180 mcg/min)

name: Propofol
reference: ICU sedation(intubated patients): 0.3 to 3 mg/kg/hr

name: Salbutamol
reference: 5 mcg/min, increase by 5 mcg/min to a maximum of 20 mcg/min

name: Theophylline
reference:
The dose must be individualized according to serum theophylline level (10-20 mcg/mL).
Adult: loading dose: 4.6 mg/kg over 30 min, maintenance: 0.4 mg/kg/hr, MAX dose 900 mg/day

name: Thiopental
reference: Loading Dose: 2-3 mg/kg for barbiturate-induced coma, Maintenance Dose: 3-5 mg/kg/hour (may be as high as 15mg/kg/hour)
